source.name: large language models
source.instructions: **If you are using a pre-trained model, why does your hardware often need to exceed the minimum requirements?**

answers.answer: Pre-trained models can still be based on very large data sets which require powerful machines.
Trick question, pre-trained models are more efficient and do not require powerful machines.
Building a model requires a powerful machine.
Training a model requires a powerful machine.

source.guidance:
The correct answer is:

>Pre-trained models can still be based on very large data sets which require powerful machines.

Despite the hard work that goes into training a language model, they are still based on very large datasets. The GPT-3 model was trained on 45 terabytes of text, making it one of the largest pre-trained models available. Using this model can stress systems that meet the minimum hardware requirements
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT explain why pre-trained models still need a powerful machine
